intro: Gavilea insularis, commonly known as the island gavilea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape and have a rough texture. Gavilea insularis is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
